info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 12:55PM EST until February 04 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie, Crawford and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow will develop this afternoon and persist into this evening. Snowfall rates of one half inch to one inch per hour are likely this afternoon and early evening. Strong north to northeast winds will produce blowing and drifting snow which could significantly reduce visibilities and impact roadways, especially east-west oriented roadways. Low temperatures tonight will reach the lower teens and wind chill advisories as low as zero to five degrees below zero are expected.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
